section.title: Application Lockdown
section.p: Settings of OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME ConsoleApplication LockdownThis feature prevents malware attacks and increases protection level by allowing only the files defined in the Application List to execute. Three modes are available for selection: Detect, Enforce and Disable.
Detect: The applications that are not in the Approved List will be allowed to run, and users will receive a notification.
Enforce: The applications that are not in the Approved List will be blocked from running, and users will receive a notification.
When users select the Detect or Enforce mode, three more protection options are available:

li.p: DLL/Driver Lockdown: DLL/Driver Lockdown prevents unapproved DLLs or drivers from being loaded into the memory of protected endpoints.
Script Lockdown: Script Lockdown prevents unapproved script files from being run on protected endpoints.
Intelligent Runtime Learning: To ensure undisturbed operations, Intelligent Runtime Learning allows runtime executable files that are generated by applications in the Approved List to run smoothly.

section.p: Disable: The Application Lockdown can also be disabled if needed, but it is advisory to have this function enabled.

section.title: Industrial-Grade Next-Generation Antivirus
section.p: Settings of OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME ConsoleIndustrial-Grade Next-Generation AntivirusIndustrial-grade next-generation antivirus (real-time malware scan) is the core protection of OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME. TXOne integrates signature-based and AI-based antivirus software to provide real-time scanning of any file or process activity.
OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME integrates OT/ICS application system recognition technology, which can greatly reduce the occurrence of false alarms.
Users can click the switch to turn the function on or off

section.title: Operations Behavior Anomaly Detection
section.p: Settings of OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME ConsoleOperations Behavior Anomaly DetectionOperationally abnormal behavior may be caused by advanced attacks (such as fileless attacks). OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME can detect the behavior of these threats and keep logs for later analysis.

This function mainly allows OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME to monitor specific high-risk applications, including wscript.exe, cscript.exe, mshta.exe, powershell.exe and psexec.exe, to stop legitimate programs from being misused. Users can add other monitoring processes via the web console.

This function has four modes, including:
Learn: After activating this function, OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME will monitor unrecognized program calls and add them to the approved operations for learning more about OT/ICS-related program call behaviors.
Detect: After activating this function, OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME will monitor unrecognized program calls and log them for future analysis.
Enforce: After activating this function, OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME will monitor unrecognized program calls and block them to secure the endpoint.
Disable: When Operations Behavior Anomaly Detection is set to Disable, the protection is turned off.

In either Detect or Enforce mode, users have one more option, Aggressive Mode, for higher antivirus security. This feature activates protection through process parameter recognition. By adding parameter identification in the monitoring task, users can check the operation process and its accompanied changes in parameters under monitoring.

section.title: OT Application Safeguard
section.p: Settings of OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME ConsoleOT Application SafeguardOT/ICS application patches or hotfixes may cause anti-virus false alarms, including potential blocking. OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME can use OT/ICS inventory technology to verify legal updates for the OT/ICS applications, and can keep recognized OT/ICS applications updated without blocking or alerts.
This function supports OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME by identifying OT/ICS application technology and providing protection that is consistent with OT/ICS application system updates.

After enabling "Protect OT application and files/folders from unauthorized changes", ICS application executable files will be protected automatically without user definition. On the other hand, OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME will monitor and protect the files and folders defined by the administrator on web console.

section.title: DLL Injection Prevention
section.p:
Settings of OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME ConsoleDLL Injection PreventionDLL injection is a high-risk attack in the OT/ICS field, and OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME can prevent this type of attack when this feature is enabled.
DLL injection can only be enabled in 32-bit Windows OSes.

section.title: Device Control
section.p: Settings of OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME ConsoleDevice ControlDevice Control is the function of OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME to control external USB storage devices to ensure that only authorized USB devices can be used on endpoints protected by OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME.

This function mainly provides identification and protection from external USB storage devices. Use the USB device's Vendor ID (VID), Product ID (PID) and Serial Number (SN) to determine whether the device is a trusted USB storage device.

Device Control grants a one-time permission to approved USB storage access after administrator authentication. When an unauthorized USB storage device is inserted into the endpoint the first time, the user will be prompted to enter the administrator password. This is set up as a single authorization to increase user convenience.
Meanwhile, OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME will send a blocked event notification to , and the administrator can view the blocked event on the console and decide to continue blocking or approving the access.

The Device Control use case is as follows:
Plug in the USB.
The USB will be blocked if Device Control is enabled and the device is untrusted.
A pop-up window appears to require users to enter the administrator password.
After granted access permission, the USB device can be allowed access until unplugged.
Users can click the switch to turn on or off the function.

section.title: Maintenance Mode
section.p: Settings of OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME ConsoleMaintenance ModeTo perform file updates on endpoints, users can configure Maintenance Mode settings to define a period when OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME allows all file executions and adds all files that are created, executed, or modified to the Approved List.

During the maintenance period, all newly-added files can be updated accompanied with real-time virus scan for consistent security. OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME can learn the newly-added applications and ensure the execution of these applications are under protection.

note.p: If users change the policy settings of Application Lockdown, OT Application Safeguard, and Real-Time Malware Scan (Industrial-Grade Next-Generation Antivirus) during maintenance period, the policy settings will not be enforced until the maintenance period ends.
